unnormalised: Hey folks! Ever felt that adrenaline rush when you see a crazy discount pop up online? That’s the magic of a flash sale! In the wild world of retail & e-commerce, these aren't just sales, they're sprints – a race against the clock to snag that dream item at a price that seems almost too good to be true.

unnormalised: Think of it like this: You’re at a wedding in Delhi, surrounded by mountains of delicious biryani. Everyone’s rushing to grab their share before it's all gone. That’s pretty much what a flash sale is like!

unnormalised: So, what exactly *is* a flash sale? It's a short, intense promotional period offering significant discounts on specific products or collections. We’re talking deep discounts, often 50% off or even more! The catch? The sale usually lasts for a very limited time – maybe just a few hours, or even less! Imagine a saree you’ve been eyeing is suddenly 70% off… but only for the next 3 hours!

unnormalised: Why do companies like Myntra and Ajio run these things? Well, for starters, they create a sense of urgency. That ticking clock makes you less likely to overthink your purchase (guilty as charged!). They also help clear out old inventory quickly and efficiently. Think of all those kurtas and jhumkas from last Diwali they need to make room for!

unnormalised: Flash sales can be a fantastic way to snag a bargain, but remember to be strategic, yaars! Don't get caught up in the hype and buy something you don't really need. Do your research beforehand, know your budget, and be ready to click that "Buy Now" button like you're booking tickets for a Rajinikanth movie on the first day!
